reasoning: Extremely rare autosomal recessive metabolic disorder. Estimated incidence <1 per million births (<0.1 per 100k) based on registry data from Europe. PH1 is the most common and severe form of primary hyperoxaluria.
source: Cochat P et al. (1995). Primary hyperoxaluria Type 1: indications for screening and guidance for diagnosis and treatment. Nephrol Dial Transplant. 10(11):1746-53
